intro: Xylopia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed xylopia, is a tropical plant belonging to the Annonaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and alternate, simple, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in axillary or terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple or black color, containing several seeds. Xylopia gracilipes is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
